titleStmt.title: John R. Graham to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2030

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Frankfort Feby 17th 1865
To his Excellency The Governor of Kentucky

I respectfully beg leave to offer my resignation to you of the Office of Police Judge of the City of Frankfort to take effect 1st March next. And solicit the appointment of John J. Quin of the City to fill the vacancy

Respectfully
Your Obt Humble Sevt
John R Graham

We the undersigned as members of the board of councilmen of the city of Frankfort and also as citizens of said city, take pleasure in recommending to your favorable consideration, Mr. J. J. Quin as a suitable person to fill the office of Police Judge of the City of Frankfort

G. W. Gwin
R Runegan
J. Baltzell
James M. Todd
A H Rennick
